Passio D.N. Iesv Christi Venvstissimis Imaginibvs Eleganter Expressa ab, Luca Cranogio Anno. 1509., Visscherius, Amsterdam
Passio D. N. Jesu Christi, venustissimis imaginibus eleganter expressa ab illustrissimi Saxoniae ducis Luca Cranagio Anno 1509. Wittenberg
'Passionalbuch. Vom Leiden und Auferstehung unseres Herrn Jesu Christi', Georg Rhau, Wittenberg [http://gateway-bayern.de/VD16+B+4780; accessed 11-07-2019]
'Passionalbuch. Vom Leiden und Auferstehung unseres Herrn Jesu Christi', Georg Rhau, Wittenberg [http://gateway-bayern.de/VD16+B+4782; accessed 11-07-2019]
'Passionalbuch. Vom Leiden und Auferstehung unseres Herrn Jesu Christi', Georg Rhau, Wittenberg [http://gateway-bayern.de/VD16+B+4786; accessed 11-07-2019]

pageContext.description:
The Entombment from the 'Passion Christi', a series of 14 woodcuts.
Of the series only the second block is signed with the monogram LC, the winged serpent and dated; The Flagellation, The Crucifixion and The Resurrection are signed with the winged serpent insignia.
The prints were distributed both in editions of single sheets and bound in books. Numerous editions between 1509 and 1616 have been recorded.
[cda 2019]

ref.dimensions:
sheet: 24.6 x 17.1 cm
[Exhib. Cat. Düsseldorf 2017, No. 42]

ref.description: - version with decorative frame and lettered text
ref.inscription: Below the image, lettered: '13. Er ist begraben wie Gottlosen, vnd gestorben wie ein Reicher. Esaie liij.'

ref.description:
Christ before Caiphas from the 'Passion Christi', a series of 14 woodcuts.
Of the series only the second block is signed with the monogram LC, the winged serpent and dated; The Flagellation, The Crucifixion and The Resurrection are signed with the winged serpent insignia.

additionalTextInformation.text:
In Hollstein the Passion series is illustrated in the correct order, but two titles have been swapped around: the correct title for no. 12 is : 'Christ before Caiphas' and respectively no. 13 depicts 'Christ before Annas' 

[cda 2019]

ref.description:
The Lamentation from the 'Passion Christi', a series of 14 woodcuts.
Of the series only the second block is signed with the monogram LC, the winged serpent and dated; The Flagellation, The Crucifixion and The Resurrection are signed with the winged serpent insignia.
The prints were distributed both in editions of single sheets and bound in books. Numerous editions between 1509 and 1616 have been recorded.
[cda 2019]

titles.title: The Resurrection (from the Passion Christi, series of 14 woodcuts)

ref.description:
The Resurrection from the 'Passion Christi', a series of 14 woodcuts.
Of the series only the second block is signed with the monogram LC, the winged serpent and dated. This image as well as The Flagellation and The Crucifixion are signed with the winged serpent insignia.
The prints were distributed both in editions of single sheets and bound in books. Numerous editions between 1509 and 1616 have been recorded.
[cda 2019]
ref.signature: Artist's insignia in the block on the wall at the right: serpent (with elevated wings)
